data.title: Habanero Capuchino
data.description: Very productive Habanero, which has deep corrugation. Matures form light brown to dark red-brown. Very tasty flavor and very hot! Capsicum chinense.

data.title: Purple Habanero
data.description: Purple Habanero provides very variable shaped pods that sometimes are strongly wrinkled. Their colour turns from red to mahogany-purple when fully matured. Very hot Capsicum chinense variety with good taste.

data.title: Red Savina
data.description: Former Guiness World Record Holder, Selection of a superhot Habanero (Capsicum chinense), maybe identical to Caribbean Red. Strong plants with excellent yields.

data.title: Jays Peach Ghost Scorpion
data.description: Extremely hot cross between Bhut jolokia und Trinidad Scorpion developed by farmer Jay in Pennsylvania (Capsicum chinense).

data.title: Jays Red Ghost Scorpion
data.description: Extremely hot cross between Bhut jolokia und Trinidad Scorpion developed by farmer Jay in Pennsylvania (Capsicum chinense).

data.title: 7pot Brainstrain Red
data.description: 7pot Brainstrain (Capsicum chinense) has been detected by David Cappiello. A plant grown from a seed sample of 7pot SR showed a strange shape. Vigorous growing plants produce large crops of extremely hot pods. Shape and surface of fruits is variable, first pods are small with smooth surface, whereas later fruits a large and have a rough surface.

data.title: Apocalypse Chocolate
data.description: Very hot brown pheno type, split off from Apocalypse, an Italian Capsicum chinense crossing, development stage F3. The plants provide a very good crop of extremely hot and very tasty pods. Since this variety is still on a lower development stage, it is to be expected that there will be some variations within the next generation.

data.title: Brazilian Starfish
data.description: Capsicum baccatum variety with very nicer pod shape remembering a gear wheel. Medium heat, high yields on large plants. Good to overwinter at a cool place with bright light.

data.title: Fish Pepper
data.description: Very old variety, that has been cultivated since 1900 in the region of Philadelphia. Plants and fruits are variegated. In fish dishes immature pods with green-white coloring are used. These are slightly hot. During maturation the variegated coloring of the pods turn to a even matt dark red

data.title: Aurora
data.description: Aurora is an ornamental Capsicum annuum variety. First the pods are purple and then turn from orange to red when maturing.

data.title: 7pot White
data.description: This variety of 7pot starts pure white and matures to ivory yellow. Fruity taste and extremely hot, Capsicum chinense

data.title: Carolina Reaper
data.description: Guiness World Record Holder, around 1.400.000 SCU. Extremely hot Capsicum chinense variety similar or identical to 7pot Primo
